text: Dambrowka Lock (), Dąbrówka Lock () - Seventeenth lock on the Augustów Canal (from the Biebrza). Built in 1829 by George Arnold. The second of the three locks lying on the territory of Belarus. It was renovated in the years 2005 - 2006 and functions as a shipping facility. * Location: 91.5 km channel * Level difference: 3.04 m * Length: 43.9 m * Width: 6.10 m * Gates: Wooden * Year built: 1829 * Construction Manager: Jerzy Arnold ==References== * * * Category:19th-century establishments in Belarus Category:Locks of Belarus
title: Dambrowka Lock
